events.name: Kotlin Night
events.description:
Kotlin Night is a meetup that includes 3-4 talks on Kotlin or related technologies. JetBrains has already organised and hosted a couple of Kotlin Nights in San Francisco and London.

As GDG Harare Institute of Technology we have therefore partnered with Kotlin experts in Zimbabwe  and JetBrains to host our first ever Kotlin night of many to come.

AGENDA:
4:00 PM - Attendee Registration 
4:15 PM -  Talk 1: Kotlin for Starters an Introductory Talk
4:45 PM - Talk 2: TBA*
5:15 PM - Vote of thanks, Fireside Chat, Q & As
5:30 PM - Wrap Up and Networking

events.name: GDG HIT CLOUD STUDY JAM 2018
events.description:
• What we'll do
Enhance your skills whilst broadening your technical knowhow through the following:
Learn how to set up development and production environments in the Cloud.
● Learn how Docker and Kubernetes work, or learn how to process Big Data in the Cloud.
● Get access to Qwiklabs.com, a Google training tool, free of charge (a $70+ value).
● Get Google-hosted badges like this for their online profiles, to show potential employers what they know about Cloud computing.

• What to bring
Your laptop and a prospective tech lady!

• Important to know
Open only to HIT students

events.name: GDG HIT IWD Extended

venue.name: B2C Coworking
venue.address_1: Cnr Jason Moyo Ave and First Street, Harare, Zimbabwe

events.description:
We are proud to be hosting the 2018 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference. This event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs.

We intend to kickstart at a high and exciting nite for ladies, a Women Techmakers Chapter in Harare of Zimbabwe! We aim that women may be encouraged to uphold and support one another in technological advancements through continual meetups after this launch.

PS: This event is open to all.

events.name: GDG Tensorflow Dev Summit Extended
events.description:
• What we'll do
A viewing party of highly technical talks, demos and conversation with TensorFlow team and community. A Machine Learning introductory tech talk to also be delivered and a mentorship session to round up the meeting.

• What to bring
Your laptop and an open mind!

• Important to know
Event is open only to HIT students
Do bring a lady in tech along please

events.name: Women Techmakers Hub Launch

venue.name: B2C Coworking
venue.address_1: Cnr Jason Moyo Ave and First Street, Harare, Zimbabwe

events.description: Women Techmakers Hub is here to empower women in all fields to develop their technical and entrepreneurial skills through mentorship and networking. Be empowered to be successful in tech by connecting, supporting and celebrating one another. Tell a lady to tell another lady!

events.name: HIT DSC ANDROID DEV SUMMIT

venue.name: B2C Coworking
venue.address_1: Cnr Jason Moyo Ave and First Street, Harare, Zimbabwe

events.description:
Please note that participants are expected to install Android Studio and download SDK packages prior to the event.

Here is a general overview of the program

Morning
10:00 – 10:15 Opening remarks
10:15 – 11:00 Build your first Android App part 1
11:00 – 12:00 Build Your First Android App part2

Noon
Break

Afternoon
12:15 – 13:00 Creating an App Using Alarm Manager
13:00 – 13:15 Closing remarks

events.name: Africa Code Week
events.description:
Do you own a laptop that you can donate for a day along with your time? Join us this Saturday as we mentor young girls in technology through an introduction to basic block programming. No coding expertise is required, just your laptop and mouse if you have one! Kindly sign up via the link provided below to specify your tshirt size and level of commitment to this cause. Transport will be provided from ZIMPOST at 08:00, lunch is covered too

Background:
There is a huge digital divide between children in urban areas
and children from peri-urban and rural areas and this year’s
ACW Zimbabwe aims to bridge this gap.
The vision is that if children are taught how to code from a
tender age and are nurtured as they grow, they can come up
with lasting digital solutions to problems their communities
face. Coding can also open the eyes of the children to
different career options other than the traditional careers that
they are exposed to, not that there is anything wrong with
them.
We hope to keep this initiative going by setting up a coding
club in the community we are going to train to continue to
encourage any spark of interest we might generate during
ACW Zimbabwe. In this digital age coding is a critical skill set
for building an outstanding individual’s mindset where they can
make a positive impact to their community and the world as a
whole from a tender age.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam-HIT

venue.name: B2C Coworking
venue.address_1: Cnr Jason Moyo Ave and First Street, Harare, Zimbabwe

events.description:
Join us for this year's Cloud Study Jam event, where we'll bring together cloud enthusiasts and the developer community to be a part of the Next '18 experience.

This year, we will be diving deep into cloud with technical keynotes, a hands-on TOPIC (Kubernetes, ML, or Google Cloud Certification) lab, and local speakers.

As an attendee, you'll not only be a part of our vibrant cloud community but also receive free access to Qwiklabs (a $55+ value)!

Don't forget to bring a laptop (PC, Mac, or Chromebook), and get ready for the best Next Extended yet!

Make sure to RSVP to receive upcoming information about this event, and visit https://cloudnext.withgoogle.com/ to learn more about Google Cloud Next '18.

events.name: DSC HIT IFirebase Session
events.description: This is our first meetup for the semester. Join us as we deliberate on the expectations of members for the new year and open doors to the vast resources Google offers us for personal development of participants. The first resource we will be diving into being Firebase!

events.name: Harare IWD Celebrations
events.description:
This is a two day event engaging High School Students, University students and developers in a design thinking and application development hackathon. Corporates are also invited to get started on their journey to earning an online badge for Google Cloud Platform architecturing.

There will be a design thinking tutorial by Engineer Masiyazi and Doctor Garikayi as well as fun challenges for High School students led by Engineer Kadebu. High school teams of five will be mentored by a developer representing a team of three whilst the teachers will moderate the discussions. This team will identify a problem and come up with an implentable solution and design a storyboard for it.

The developer teams will now implement these solutions into prototypes.
Meanwhile, a panel of judges and congress of corporates engage in GCP Internet of Things Codelabs amongst discussions. At day end of the 23rd of March, the teams will present their prototypes to this audience and winners are determined. The teams should take note of the feedback they receive on pitching and use it to perfect their ideas until June where the 8 participants of each team are to all pitch their finished products to companies that may be willing to invest in them.

We urge all developers to form teams and get a chance to be mentored into seeing their dreams to life. Corporates, we appeal to you to support our budding developers as you also enhance your career by adding accreditation of the Cloud Platform from Google's Qwiklabs!

See you all there!

events.name: Google I/O Extended

venue.name: B2C Coworking
venue.address_1: Cnr Jason Moyo Ave and First Street, Harare, Zimbabwe

events.description:
Welcome to Google I/O Extended 2019 for our DSC Chapter! Lets have a watch party to learn and discuss on the key new features Google is bringing to the table both for end-users and us as Developers! The biggest surprise is also in store for you! A Google Developer Expert will call in to answer all your questions, concerns and share your excitement on any features that blew your mind! Kindly participate on the discussion we have started on Twitter to answer any questions your might have for our GDE as a developer in Africa at https://twitter.com/dsc_hit.

See you there!

events.name: Ladies Web Dev Bootcamp
events.description:
Are you a young woman ready to make money through tech!
If you are below 35 and have time to attend a workshop series for web development in 5 days (15-19 July) to make this dream come true....
Sign up to save a seat on the link below.

http://bit.ly/2KdTaX7

And guess what ? *lts free!* but seats ate limited.

group_profile.intro: Stop Stopping and Do Cool Things That Matter!
I'm in love with code, keeps me alive and I'll stop at nothing to execute programs to life with as many as possible
